org.sopra.api.exercises.exercise5

Class AbstractEnergyNetworkAnalyzer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.sopra.api.exercises.exercise5.AbstractEnergyNetworkAnalyzer

  • public abstract class AbstractEnergyNetworkAnalyzer
extends java.lang.Object

    The Energy Network Analyzer is used to calculate maximum loads for power lines, power plants and consumers in energy networks.

    The method createFlowGraph(org.sopra.api.model.Graph<org.sopra.api.model.EnergyNode, org.sopra.api.model.PowerLine>, java.util.Optional<java.util.Map<org.sopra.api.model.producer.Producer, java.lang.Integer>>, java.util.Optional<java.util.Map<org.sopra.api.model.consumer.Consumer, java.lang.Integer>>) provides functionality to convert energy graphs to flow graphs. The method calculateMaxFlow() uses the converted energy graph as input for calculation of maximum loads. The results of the calculation are provided in getConsumerLevels(), getProducerLevels(), and getPowerLineLevels().

      • AbstractEnergyNetworkAnalyzer

        public AbstractEnergyNetworkAnalyzer(Graph<EnergyNode,PowerLine> graph,
                                     java.util.Optional<java.util.Map<Producer,java.lang.Integer>> producerCapacities,
                                     java.util.Optional<java.util.Map<Consumer,java.lang.Integer>> consumerCapacities)

        Basic constructor. Calls implementation of createFlowGraph(org.sopra.api.model.Graph<org.sopra.api.model.EnergyNode, org.sopra.api.model.PowerLine>, java.util.Optional<java.util.Map<org.sopra.api.model.producer.Producer, java.lang.Integer>>, java.util.Optional<java.util.Map<org.sopra.api.model.consumer.Consumer, java.lang.Integer>>) with constructor arguments producerCapacities, and consumerCapacities to initialize attribute flowGraph.

        The Map producerLevels, consumerLevels, and powerlineLevels are initialized with nodes of argument graph as keys and 0 values.

        Parameters:
        graph - The energy graph to be analyzed. Used as input parameter for createFlowGraph(org.sopra.api.model.Graph<org.sopra.api.model.EnergyNode, org.sopra.api.model.PowerLine>, java.util.Optional<java.util.Map<org.sopra.api.model.producer.Producer, java.lang.Integer>>, java.util.Optional<java.util.Map<org.sopra.api.model.consumer.Consumer, java.lang.Integer>>)
        producerCapacities - Used as input parameter for createFlowGraph(org.sopra.api.model.Graph<org.sopra.api.model.EnergyNode, org.sopra.api.model.PowerLine>, java.util.Optional<java.util.Map<org.sopra.api.model.producer.Producer, java.lang.Integer>>, java.util.Optional<java.util.Map<org.sopra.api.model.consumer.Consumer, java.lang.Integer>>)
        consumerCapacities - Used as input parameter for createFlowGraph(org.sopra.api.model.Graph<org.sopra.api.model.EnergyNode, org.sopra.api.model.PowerLine>, java.util.Optional<java.util.Map<org.sopra.api.model.producer.Producer, java.lang.Integer>>, java.util.Optional<java.util.Map<org.sopra.api.model.consumer.Consumer, java.lang.Integer>>).
        See Also:
        createFlowGraph(org.sopra.api.model.Graph<org.sopra.api.model.EnergyNode, org.sopra.api.model.PowerLine>, java.util.Optional<java.util.Map<org.sopra.api.model.producer.Producer, java.lang.Integer>>, java.util.Optional<java.util.Map<org.sopra.api.model.consumer.Consumer, java.lang.Integer>>)

    • Method Detail

      • createFlowGraph

        public abstract FlowGraph<EnergyNode> createFlowGraph(Graph<EnergyNode,PowerLine> graph,
                                                      java.util.Optional<java.util.Map<Producer,java.lang.Integer>> producerCapacities,
                                                      java.util.Optional<java.util.Map<Consumer,java.lang.Integer>> consumerCapacities)

        Creates the FlowGraph on basis of the given energy Graph.

        The created FlowGraph contains all nodes of given energy Graph and additionally contains the super source node provided in super_source and the super sink node provided in super_sink.

        For each power line in the given energy graph, two flow edges with opposed directions and equal capacities are created. The capacity of the flow edges is equal to the capacity of the power line.

        For energy nodes of type Producer additional edges going from super_source to every producer node are created. If the Optional of the producerCapacities argument is empty, the capacity of edges from super_source to each producer is equal to the provided energy level (Producer.getProvidedPower()) of the corresponding producer. Otherwise, the capacities correspond to the values of the producerCapacities argument.

        For energy nodes of type Consumer additional edges going from every consumer node to super_sink are created. If the Optional of the consumerCapacities argument is empty, the capacity of edges from each consumer to super_sink is equal to the required energy level (Consumer.getRequiredPower()) of the corresponding consumer. Otherwise, the capacities correspond to the values of the consumerCapacities argument.

        Parameters:
        graph - The energy graph which is to be converted to a flow graph.
        producerCapacities - If present, initializes capacities from super_source to producer (key) with integer (value) of given Map.
        consumerCapacities - If present, initializes capacities from consumers (key) to super_sink with integer (value) of given Map.
        Returns:
        The FlowGraph corresponding to the given energy Graph.

      • calculateMaxFlow

        public abstract void calculateMaxFlow()
